body: It is not used. It's used as a container for the unique_ptr to the nets. If the InferTensorShape... function has signature that takes vector<unique_ptr> then you cannot call it with existing structures, only newly created. I changed it to taking just vector<Netdef*> .
body_html: It is not used. It's used as a container for the unique_ptr to the nets. If the InferTensorShape... function has signature that takes vector<unique_ptr> then you cannot call it with existing structures, only newly created. I changed it to taking just vector<Netdef*> .
body_text: It is not used. It's used as a container for the unique_ptr to the nets. If the InferTensorShape... function has signature that takes vector<unique_ptr> then you cannot call it with existing structures, only newly created. I changed it to taking just vector<Netdef*> .
